sentences.en: 'Carnage at Airport ', screamed the tabloid headline.
sentences.cn: 通俗小报的标题耸人听闻: “ 机场喋血”.

sentences.en: A full-scale character assassination of the dead woman got underway in the tabloid press.
sentences.cn: 小报上开始了对那位已故女士全方位的人身攻击。

sentences.en: A tabloid lonely hearts columnist who answers questions from readers.
sentences.cn: 小报上往往有求友、求婚的专栏,主持这个专栏并负责回答读者来信的人.

sentences.en: Clarke swung at his shadow the accusation that he was "a tabloid politician".
sentences.cn: 克拉克指责影子内阁中的对手是个“八卦政客”.

sentences.en: He believes that the tabloid press has behaved disgracefully.
sentences.cn: 他认为小报媒体的行为不太光彩.

sentences.en: I think he was born to be editor of a tabloid newspaper.
sentences.cn: 我觉得他天生就是当小报编辑的料。

sentences.en: In fact, according to extracts from a book published in a UK tabloid, Tatum told a friend: 'How can any girl have a relationship with him?
sentences.cn: 事实上，根据这英国小报出版的这本书的摘要来看，塔图姆曾经告诉她的朋友，“姑娘们怎么会和他有亲密关系？

sentences.en: It was tabloid size and had only eight pages, which were badly printed.
sentences.cn: 那是一份小开报纸,只有八页, 印刷得很粗糙.

sentences.en: Nor is the News of the World just any tabloid.
sentences.cn: 但“世界新闻”绝非其他小报可比.

sentences.en: Sadly, a few tabloid newspapers got hold of this under - the - table gossip.
sentences.cn: 更为糟糕的是几家惯于耸人听闻的报纸抓住这些私下闲谈大作文章.

sentences.en: She is an object of ridicule in the tabloid newspapers.
sentences.cn: 她是小报讥笑讽刺的对象。

sentences.en: Some tabloid newspapers cater to low tastes.
sentences.cn: 有些小报迎合低级趣味.

sentences.en: Tabloid newspapers pander to the lowest common denominator.
sentences.cn: 小报都竭力迎合大众口味。

sentences.en: Thanks largely to some splendid muckraking by the Guardian, it is now clear how one tabloid obtained some of its headlines.
sentences.cn: 主要是由于一些由《卫报》的成功揭丑，现在已很清楚一个小报是怎样获取它的头条新闻的。

sentences.en: The tabloid papers are full of smut.
sentences.cn: 这些小报充斥着下流的东西.

sentences.en: The tabloid press kicked up a stink about his seven-day visit.
sentences.cn: 小报的报道引起民众对他为期7天的访问的强烈不满。

words.tran_cn: 小报式的；缩略的；轰动性的；扼要的
小报；药片；文摘；小型画报

trans.tran_cn: 小报，通俗小报，药片，文摘，小型画报
trans.tran_en: a newspaper that has small pages, a lot of photographs, and stories mainly about sex, famous people etc rather than serious news
